titleStmt.title: Dispatch from Héli Chatelain to William F. Wharton, February 10, 1893

bibl.title: Héli Chatelain to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

div1.p:
Commercial Agency of the United States,
at Loanda, Washington Febr. 10, 1893

Mr. Heli Chatelain
To the Department of State.
Property of U.S. Gabon Commercial Agency
(2) American Mission willing to acquire furniture at a reasonable price

Commercial Agency of the United States,
at Loanda, Washington Febr. 10, 1893

Honorable Wm. F. Wharton
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.
On my way hence I visited the U.S. Commercial Agency at Gaboon and ascertained the state of its property.

It consists of:
1 book case
1 desk
1 lounge
1 revolving office chair
The customary collections of Consular Reports, Statutes etc.
A trunk containing old letters
The usual Records and forums
The furniture has been preserved in fair condition.
The Records do not contain anything of importance.

If the Department decides to sell
the furniture, the American Mission at Gaboon, which has hitherto taken care of it, is disposed to buy it at a moderate price.

I have the honor to be, Sir,
your obedient servant
Heli Chatelain
U.S. Coml Agent
